units.title: Generate organoids in 96-well plates
units.text: organoids were generated in 96-well plates, where pluripotent stem cells (WTC, H9 and HES3 lines; the latter modified to report the expression of the retinal progenitor marker NKX2-1) were aggregated into embryoid bodies and cultured in minimal neural induction media (MNIM) to induce neuroectodermal fates (Fig. 1a).
units.rationale: Creates uniform embryoid bodies for downstream patterning.

units.title: Apply morphogen treatment panel
units.text: Developing organoids were then subjected to a panel of morphogen treatments with varying timing, concentration and combination of the molecules CHIR99021 (CHIR, WNT pathway activator), XAV939 (WNT pathway inhibitor), rh‑SHH/CS24II (SHH) and purmorphamine, FGF‑8B (FGF8), RA, rhBMP‑4 (BMP4), rhBMP‑7 (BMP7) at early and intermediate time points (days 0–3, 10–13 and 14–17).
units.rationale: Tests the effect of multiple morphogens on regional specification.

units.title: Use concentration gradients or static doses
units.text: We applied concentration gradients in microfluidic chips or increasing static concentrations in multi‑well plates and observe different patterning dynamics in each scenario.
units.rationale: Enables comparison of dynamic versus static morphogen exposure.

units.title: Prepare single‑cell suspensions and hash cells
units.text: Each condition (Supplementary Fig. 1) were pooled and dissociated into single‑cell suspensions, followed by cell hashing with barcoded antibodies and processing for single‑cell transcriptome sequencing (3′ mRNA, 10x Genomics; Fig. 1b).
units.rationale: Allows multiplexed scRNA‑seq of many treatment conditions.

units.title: Quantify cell‑type diversity
units.text: We measured the heterogeneity of each patterning condition at multiple time points, concentrations and combinations, and use the Shannon diversity index, where lower scores indicate lower cell‑type diversity.
units.rationale: Provides a metric to compare compositional homogeneity across conditions.

units.title: Validate regional markers by HCR
units.text: In situ hybridization chain reaction (HCR) stainings confirmed the presence of more retinal progenitors (SFRP2+) at lower RA concentrations and more ventralized and posterior fates (FOXA2+) at higher RA concentrations.
units.rationale: Confirms transcriptional findings at the protein level.

units.title: Integrate scRNA‑seq data
units.text: We integrated the data using reference similarity spectrum (RSS) and embedded the dataset with uniform manifold approximation and projection (UMAP) (Fig. 1c–e).
units.rationale: Creates a unified visual representation of all treatment datasets.

units.title: Compute cluster enrichment/depletion scores
units.text: We calculated cluster enrichment/depletion scores for each treatment (Fig. 2a–c, Extended Data Figs. 3a–k and 4a,b and Supplementary Table 3).
units.rationale: Identifies which cell populations are promoted or suppressed by each morphogen.

units.title: Assess single‑pulse morphogen effects
units.text: a single pulse of certain treatments also showed remarkable effects, such as RA promoting non‑neural ectoderm at early time points but retinal and hindbrain progenitors when supplied at later time points.
units.rationale: Demonstrates that brief exposure windows can drive distinct lineage outcomes.
